p: Xanthones are heterocyclic compounds having a dibenzo-Î³-pyrone skeleton as the basic structure. They constitute the primary compounds of lichens and have also been reported in microorganisms [ 15]. Xanthones are classified into the following five major groups: simple oxygenated xanthones, xanthone glycosides, prenylated and related xanthones, xanthonelignoids, and miscellaneous xanthones [ 16]. Xanthones have been abundantly reported in the angiosperm families, namely Gentianaceae, Clusiaceae, Moraceae, and Polygonaceae. More than 70 xanthones have been reported from Garcinia species, especially from the mangosteen fruit [ 17]. The first xanthone isolated from Indian gamboge seeds was morellin ( 1) [ 6, 7]. Desoxymorellin ( 2), dihydromorellin ( 3), and isomorellin ( 7) were isolated from its seeds and resin previously [ 5, 12]. Gambogic acid ( 5) was isolated from leaves and resin [ 3, 10, 11]. Later, morellinol ( 8) and moreollin ( 9) were isolated from the seeds of Indian gamboge [ 8, 9]. Similarly, isomorellic acid ( 6) and morellic acid ( 4) were extracted from its resin [ 11].
